creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Christ standing to R of gnarled tree, facing a grotesque figure with beastly head, wings, webbed fingers, fish tail, and human legs; at ULC, small image of Christ on a plateau; at UR, small image of Christ standing atop a building, in both miniatures facing a similar looking beast
inscription:
Signature, Inscription

-- numbered in plate at upper right: [11.]
-- on verso, old 20th-century price code.
portfolio: From From the Life of Christ, Plate 11
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
text: Figuring Jesus would be worn down after 40 days and 40 nights of fasting, Satan tempts him three times (Matthew 4:1-11). Eagle-eyed viewers will find all three narrated here: Satan taunts Jesus to turn stones into bread to satisfy his hunger, plunge off a temple and be rescued by angels, and worship Satan on a mountain in exchange for great riches.
title: The Temptation of Christ, From the Life of Christ, Plate 11
